She worked at an insurance firm, where she met her future husband, John, a business executive; they married in 1947.[4] They had two children, John and Jane, before moving to London in 1955. She went on to study law at Trinity College, Cambridge, graduating in 1958 with a first class honours degree.[5]
In 1960, Thatcher joined the Foreign Office, where her interest in international trade led her to write a book about foreign policy that was published under the title The World According to Margaret Thatcher[6] and became a bestseller. Correction: The statement "as Home Secretary during and after the Falklands War" should be changed to "as Prime Minister during and after the Falklands War."
